name: ListOrderCustomAttributes
description:
Retrieve custom attributes associated with an order.

This tool fetches the custom attributes linked to a specific order, optionally including their definitions. It provides all visible custom attributes, including those owned by other applications with specific visibility settings.

parameters.name: target_order_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the target order to retrieve custom attributes for.

parameters.name: custom_attributes_visibility
parameters.description: Specify which custom attributes to return: 'ALL', 'READ', or 'READ_WRITE'.

value_schema.description: Requests that all of the custom attributes be returned, or only those that are read-only or read-write.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor used to retrieve the next page of results in a paginated response.

value_schema.description:
The cursor returned in the paged response from the previous call to this endpoint. 
Provide this cursor to retrieve the next page of results for your original request. 
For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of custom attribute results returned per page. Accepts values from 1 to 100, default is 20.

value_schema.description:
The maximum number of results to return in a single paged response. This limit is advisory. 
The response might contain more or fewer results. The minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 100. 
The default value is 20.
For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

parameters.name: include_custom_attribute_definitions
parameters.description: Set to true to include custom attribute definition details such as name, description, and data type. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description:
Indicates whether to return the [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition) in the `definition` field of each
custom attribute. Set this parameter to `true` to get the name and description of each custom attribute, 
information about the data type, or other definition details. The default value is `false`.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

parameters.name: visibility_filter
parameters.description: Requests that all of the custom attributes be returned, or only those that are read-only or read-write.

value_schema.description: Requests that all of the custom attributes be returned, or only those that are read-only or read-write.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return in a single paged response. This limit is advisory. 
The response might contain more or fewer results. The minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 100. 
The default value is 20.
For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

value_schema.description:
The maximum number of results to return in a single paged response. This limit is advisory. 
The response might contain more or fewer results. The minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 100. 
The default value is 20.
For more information, see [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination).

parameters.name: with_definitions
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to return the [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition) in the `definition` field of each
custom attribute. Set this parameter to `true` to get the name and description of each custom attribute, 
information about the data type, or other definition details. The default value is `false`.

value_schema.description:
Indicates whether to return the [custom attribute definition](entity:CustomAttributeDefinition) in the `definition` field of each
custom attribute. Set this parameter to `true` to get the name and description of each custom attribute, 
information about the data type, or other definition details. The default value is `false`.
